string.text: Breaking down the door to a seemingly abandoned cottage, you're surprised to find a collection of villagers hiding inside, mainly women, children, and elders. They beg for your mercy, and you decide not to kill them on the spot - after all, they may turn out to be more valuable as prisoners than as corpses.
Continue raiding!

Making your way through an unusually well-appointed cottage, your keen eyes discover a hatch hidden under an unusually-placed carpet. Your eyes glisten with deadly sin as you discover a hidden cache of gold inside. An auspicious start to what will doubtless be a very profitable day...

You notice a thin trail of flattened grass by the side of the road, and stepping off to investigate discover an unmarked barrel. It's a bit damaged, having apparently fallen off the back of a cart, but remains intact enough that when you pop the cork the smell of sweet wine floods your senses.
Share it with the troops to boost morale.

You hear the sound of ravens ahead, cawing and fighting each other over something hidden just over the next ridge. As you approach, you realize the birds have made an extravagant feast out of some unfortunate soul's corpse. The body appears to be that of a warrior, still wearing damaged armor.
Move on quickly.
You find an odd sack by the side of the road; it looks as though it was abandoned recently, and upon opening it you discover a sum of gold inside. Fresh tracks lead away into the distance.
Take it and move on quickly.
You reach for your money-pouch, only to find it missing from your belt. You don't recall where you saw it last - was it stolen or simply dropped?
Accept the loss and move on.
You come upon an effervescent spring, smelling slightly of sulfur. Fanciful childhood tales of secret healing springs danced in your head.
Take a drink.
Don't touch it.
You take a drink out of the spring. Maybe it was a bad idea as you feel nauseous.
Maybe I shouldn't have drank that.
You take a drink out of the spring. It feels refreshing.
That was nice.
Sell it at the next town.
Let everyone drink freely and celebrate.
Leave it, could be poisoned.
Examine the body carefully for clues and valuables.
Loot the body quickly.
Give the warrior a proper burial.
Search the area thoroughly for more.
Follow the tracks to find who dropped it.
Backtrack and search carefully.
Question the troops about suspicious behavior.
Carefully test the water's properties first.
Your medical knowledge allows you to identify the spring's healing properties. You carefully bottle some of the water and share it with those who need it most.
Use the water to treat the wounded.
A well-guarded merchant caravan approaches on the road. The lead merchant waves cordially, offering to share the road and perhaps conduct some business.
Negotiate a profitable trade deal.
Gather information about the region.
Buy some supplies.
Continue on your way.
You come upon a wounded traveler lying by the roadside. They've been attacked by bandits and are badly hurt. They plead for your help.
Treat their wounds professionally.
Give them money and basic aid.
Question them about the bandits.
You can't spare the time.
A cheerful minstrel with a lute joins your party's rest stop. They offer to perform songs and tales in exchange for a meal and some coin.
Pay generously for uplifting entertainment.
Listen to their songs and stories.
Ask for news from distant lands.
Politely decline.
You encounter a small group of deserter soldiers. They're armed but look desperate, unsure whether to beg for mercy or fight their way past you.
Convince them to join your ranks.
Intimidate them into fleeing.
Give them some gold and send them away.
Let them pass unmolested.
A group of pilgrims traveling to a holy site shares the road with you. They seem peaceful and offer blessings to those who aid travelers.
Offer protection and supplies.
Share a meal and conversation.
Exchange greetings and continue.
You stumble upon ancient ruins hidden by overgrowth. Crumbling pillars and weathered stones hint at a civilization long forgotten. Something about this place feels significant.
Conduct a thorough archaeological investigation.
Search for hidden treasures.
Quick search and move on.
Too risky, keep moving.
A magnificent herd of wild horses grazes in a nearby meadow. They're skittish but some appear strong enough to be valuable mounts if tamed.
Expertly capture and tame the finest specimens.
Attempt to catch a few horses.
Observe and appreciate their beauty.
You notice an area rich with medicinal herbs and rare plants. With proper knowledge, these could be valuable for treating wounds or selling to apothecaries.
Gather and prepare medicinal remedies.
Collect valuable herbs to sell.
Gather what you can recognize.
No time for foraging.
You come across the aftermath of a recent battle. Broken weapons, scattered armor, and fallen soldiers litter the field. The fighting must have been fierce.
Analyze tactics and salvage quality equipment.
Loot what you can quickly.
Bury the dead with respect.
Leave this grim place quickly.
Your scouts discover what appears to be a hidden cache, possibly belonging to bandits or smugglers. It's concealed but not particularly well-protected.
Expertly disable traps and loot everything.
Search carefully for traps.
Rush in and grab what you can.
Too dangerous, leave it alone.
You come across two villagers in a heated argument over land boundaries. They look to you for judgment.
Intervene and mediate fairly.
Ignore them.
The village is bustling with activity. It seems a local festival is taking place, with music, food, and dancing.
Join in the celebrations!
Buy a round of drinks for everyone.
Continue through the village.
A drunken argument escalates into a full-blown brawl near your table. Chairs are flying!
Join the fray and teach them a lesson!
Calm everyone down.
Leave the tavern before things get worse.
A wealthy patron challenges you to a high-stakes game of dice. The pile of gold on the table is substantial.
Play aggressively using your wits.
Decline the offer.
The garrison soldiers are drilling in the training yard. They seem to be practicing new formations.
Offer to instruct them.
Spar with them.
Continue on your way.
The lord of the castle is hosting a minor feast for the local notables. You are invited to join.
Attend the feast.
Decline politely.
A street beggar approaches you, claiming to be a former soldier of fortune who fell on hard times.
Give him some gold.
Try to recruit him as an informant.
Politely decline and walk away.
While walking through the market, you notice a merchant selling goods at what seems to be a suspiciously low price.
Buy and try to resell for profit.
Ignore the offer.
